answers.text: an ethnic group inhabiting India and Pakistan

qas.question: Who did the Siddi descend from?
What does the word "Siddi" derive from?
Where does the term Sayyid come from?

answers.text: the title borne by the captains of the Arab vessels that first brought Siddi settlers to the area

qas.question: When was the "black power" movement in Sindh?

context: The Siddi are <a0_0>an ethnic group inhabiting India and Pakistan<a0_0/> whose members are descended from <a1_0>Bantu peoples from Southeast Africa<a1_0/> that were brought to the Indian subcontinent as slaves by Arab and Portuguese merchants. Although it is commonly believed locally that "Siddi" derives from a word meaning "black", the term is actually derived from <a2_0>"Sayyid"<a2_0/>, <a3_0>the title borne by the captains of the Arab vessels that first brought Siddi settlers to the area<a3_0/>. In the Makran strip of the Sindh and Balochistan provinces in southwestern Pakistan, these Bantu descendants are known as the Makrani. There was a brief "Black Power" movement in Sindh in the <a4_0>1960s<a4_0/> and many Siddi are proud of and celebrate their African ancestry.
